caption: A friend and I went to eat at Kura sushi, since it would be a dream come true to eat revolving sushi that we didn't have to travel to Japan to experience. First the interior is bigger than you think it is, sitting a good amount of people even with the COVID restrictions. When it came to the 'revolving' part of the restaurant, there was none, not sure if it is COVID related or not, but there was no sushi going around to the tables, everything had to be ordered touch screen. When it came to ordering, some took a lot longer than others to arrive. There were times we had to get our waiter to check on our order in the back. Coming down to taste, it was really good for the price you're paying, and its a overall fun experience. They have choices (for people like me) who have allergies and can't eat raw fish.

A place to eat questionable sushi at lower prices. We found plastic in of our rolls which wasn't great. Decided to finish our dinner elsewhere. Unsure if it's worth the time and money when in D.C. there are other great locations with great food.
Looks like an authentic Japanese sushi bar
Best unagi don I’ve had to date. Great amount of choices. Amazing atmosphere. Awesome staff!! Would definitely come again!!
Was mediocre, fast food of sushi but not so fast

Our experience was wonderful.  On a busy night for takeout (2/14) when our regular local places were at capacity, this was a really high quality experience.  It exceeded expectations in every bite.  It came at the time promised and in great condition.  This sushi is meant to taste good after sitting a bit on the conveyer belt and that translated to the high delivery quality.  For the cost it is exceptional and the low prices allowed us to branch out in choice for the usual standbys.  Everything we had was fresh, had great texture and a lot of flavor.
Really cool place! Excellent ramen and eel nigiri!
(Translated by Google) It's expensive but delicious. There is also a charge for tea. You can also take it home.  (Original) 高いけど美味しいです。お茶も有料。持ち帰りも可能。
Great sushi!!

First review of the New Year, and what do I choose to review?  The dinner I ate on New Year's Eve to celebrate the end of 2020 and welcome 2021! Such an amazing sushi dinner to start off the New Year!  I have been craving good sushi for quite some time.  I usually get my fix annually when I go back home to Hawaii or visit California.  But with the current pandemic we are in, I was not able to travel, so you can only imagine my cravings for delicious sushi was 5/5.  Well you know what?  I also rate Kura Revolving Sushi Bar a 5/5!  Now, Kura is not your high-end sushi establishment.  It is more of an economic-means of enjoying sushi, sushi on a budget, and sushi done right!  Finally DC has an establishment that does sushi right at a decent price!  Food: 5/5 Flavors: 5/5 Quality: 5/5 Rice Quality: 5/5 Service:  4/5 COVID Safety: 5/5  Overall: 5/5  There currently is no indoor dining, and especially with a rotating belt sushi establishment, it is definitely not smart to have indoor dining at the point in the pandemic.  But you know what, you can still order takeout and it still travels well, especially with the cold weather ;-)  My biggest pet-peeve with budget-sushi is the poor quality of the rice and the amount of rice they give per piece.  Kura was able to get both right, perfectly cooked sushi, with a hint of sushi vinegar, the rice is still slightly warm, and it has a smaller amount of rice, compared to other places.  Definitely a plus!  The menu offers a wide variety of nigiri, gunkan, rolls, ramen, rice, and fried items.  Oh, did I mention...they also offer dessert!  The flavors are BOMB!  Reminds me of Genki Sushi, which I frequently eat at in Hawaii (originated from Japan) and Kura hits the home run for getting the flavors right!  Each bit, packed with flavors, you can distinguish each grain of rice (I hate overcooked sushi rice) and I would say the fresh is pretty fresh for what you can get in the DMV area.  My favorites are the spicy tuna, spicy yellow tail, salmon skin roll, spicy garlic popcorn shrimp roll (not very spicy), and of course, the california roll.  What's also great is for Shogatsu, or the New Year, Kura offered an assorted nigiri special that came with 18 pieces.  Such a great way to try a variety of nigiri in one meal.  Definitely can't wait to come back for some more!  I almost went again the next day and the day after that, but refrained haha.  Kura will definitely be a place I will come at least twice a month!  My only issue I had was when I picked up the takeout order, the server forgot my Crispy Fried Chicken, and when I asked about it, he said he forgot to tell me that they were out.  The other issue I had was I was not given any Shoyu (soy sauce), wasabi, or ginger, so that was a bummer.  Good thing I had all that at home!
Wonderful tasty fresh loved it great place be back must try please

I had a great experience in my visit! Great sushi and excellent friendly service. The desert options were also good. You will have to make a reservation before going, usually there’s a wait time but it was totally worth it!
INCREDIBLE experience and food was wonderful. Download their app to get on the waitlist ahead of time. One of the best spots in DC and a very quick walk from Gallery Place Metro

First time here and I’m impressed. The food is neatly place in the band, you pick it and eat it. The staff is friendly. The place is clean. the food is delicious. If you see some food that doesn't look appealing to you, give it a try it wont disappoint you. If you’re a seafood, sushi lover this is your place. Social distance safe. Music is soft.
This place is so good and it doesn't break your pockets!
The owner is so friendly and really wants you to enjoy yourself. The food is fresh and authentic. Loved it!!!

Wait time so long it feels like the system is messed up same with ordering. The computer wrongly added things. And I have to dock a whole point because compared to the Kura in Cali this is a bit of a mess. But great value for money. A fun time for sure.
Amazing food and a great experience
Amazing sushi!! Like I was best in Japan all things you would find in conveyor belt sushi
Amazing. So cute, novel, and clean.

Great experience. Get to have that japan revolving sushi experience as seen in japanese film/media. Food is good and good selection of drinks. A lot of movement of food flying by on the belt and animation from the screen. I will definitely return to try other dishes we didn't get to try and recommend to others to try.

I felt like I was in Japan when I dined at Kura. They use the authentic Japanese rotating sushi belt system and the sushi taste very good and fresh. If you want an authentic rotating sushi bar experience I highly recommend this place. Oh and BTW pleaseeeee get the Taiyaki ice cream for dessert!
Really cool reminds me of being in japan.

We had to wait to be seated as tables were stagnated to accommodate for social distancing. When we sat down, our friendly waitress explained every aspect of the experience and left us to try what we want. Be wary as tables can only accommodate 4 at the table, but I am sure they can make it work so that larger parties can at least talk to each other.  If you want to order food, I recommend that you order it ASAP as it does take a few minutes for them to make it. We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was quite busy so I wasn't worried about old food either.  My only star off was that our table got waters and were charged diet coke (about $12 extra total).
Great experience, great food, pleasant atmosphere.

This is a great dinner spot to visit with friends! The atmosphere was fun, the food good and the staff was very friendly. This was my first revolving sushi bar and they took care in social distancing, cleaning and kept contact minimal. My friends and I really enjoyed our night out together and the manager (sasha I think) was great! She kept checking in on us to make sure we were happy and was very personable. Definitely a fun place to hangout, a little pricey but my group split it 4 ways and it was more manageable.

This place is very cool and definitely a fun dinning experience. On the other hand the quality of the fish here is very low, you can taste it. I'm not sure if we came on a bad night but this fish made me feel sick till the next morning. I've been accustome to eating fish/raw fish since a young age, you could say i have a spoiled pallette. I know the difference between fresh fish and clearly day old fish that sat out too long. This place is 100% a fun experience but I suggest proceeding with caution if you want to eat the fish.
Mask was below nose of server. Disappointing.

As the inaugural conveyor belt sushi restaurant in DC, this place exceeded expectations. I've lived in Japan before and visited numerous other times as well and, as a result, have accumulated a fairly good amount of experience with conveyor belt sushi restaurants.  The multi-level conveyor belt system is very nice—better than even many establishments in Japan. The lower level circulates a variety of dishes for you to pick if any catch your fancy, while the upper level delivers the dishes that you personally ordered via the monitor at your table. It even has the receptacle for you to place the plates that you've finished eating, thereby automatically tallying the total number of plates you've eaten, which makes check out quick and easy. Just as with many establishments in Japan, once you've finished eating, there's a button on the ordering monitor that lets you notify the staff that you're ready to pay the tab, eliminating the need to signal and wait for your waiter to bring you the check.  The sushi itself is pretty decent. Obviously don't go in expecting top notch sushi. Conveyor belt sushi is meant to be cheap and fast, but even so, the quality here is better than what I've come to expect from conveyor sushi restaurants in the US. Service was good as well—attentive and prompt.  The only negative thing I can mention is the pricing. For a conveyor belt sushi restaurant, I felt the prices were just a little bit high for each plate. However, it's the US. Sushi is almost always gonna be expensive. I don't think this is something that they can do much about, so I'm refraining from deducting a star.  Lastly, due to covid I assume, soy sauce and wasabi must be poured and provided by the waiter, which means you'll need to call your waiter if you need refills. This is kind of a nuisance, but is very understandable given the health hazards that would be posed if they were left at the table and were exposed to all the different customers.  Overall an experience that quite closely matches what you'd get in Japan, which makes sense since Kura is a Japanese chain, but it nonetheless exceeded my expectations.
Added a nice touch for my father’s birthday 🙂

A very fun place to get quick sushi. If you’ve never tried conveyor belt sushi, then this is a must try for any sushi-lover. You’ll learn it’s quick, easy, and is an engaging experience. Also, the staff there were incredibly friendly and welcoming!

The food was good and tasty. The options are really good as well. In the other hand, the service was terrible. We didn’t get our sake until we finished the meal (45 min). My glass of water was empty all these time. The waiter wasn’t sure of the prices, items or operation. She was confused and speaker really slowly. The plastic utensils were placed on the table without any regard for Covid procedures. Waiter mask was below the nose. The service was unrealistically slow (just a few customers). There was a week old cucumber stuck to the bottom of my ordered dish... In conclusion, the franchise is amazing, but they should change the whole staff.
OMG! More of this please. The sushi were good, but the experience was the best. You also can’t beat the price. On top of that, the food is ready to be eaten as soon as you sit down!!!

Ok this place was the most awesome dining experience. Portions are decided by you the customer The food is no less than perfectly prepared and perfectly fresh The experience is both unique and entertaining. The service was over the top exceptional. Sasha or server was informative and attentive to our every need. The most polite person I’ve met in DC. The store manager Santana was knowledgeable and friendly. I cannot say enough about the food the people and the overall dining experience. Go as soon and fast as you can. You will not be disappointed.

Lived in Japan for two years and Kura is legit as Japan. 100% organic rice for y’all organic lovers. Really good selection at 2.95$. Other plates and food for higher prices Ramen, udon, dessert, etc. that popcorn garlic shrimp and seared salmon 👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼 Signed in with the app to reduce wait time.
This place is as authentic as the ones in Japan!  The price is a bit steep per plate, but I am personally glad to have Kura here in D.C.
Best tasting Japanese food. Service is great, food is fresh. Everything is amazing.

I had a positive experience. It just opened this Saturday and I had been fixing to try it. Before I talk about about the food I’ll say a couple of things about the ordering concept. The conveyor belt concept is DIFFERENT and it takes a moment to get the hang of but it is super cool and efficient. There is a wait staff there to assist with orders but the conveyor really serves its purpose to get food out to you from the sushi chef/cook to your table.  The food on the top conveyor comes directly to your table. There is another conveyor below that has a display of the food but it seems like they are not actively using it.  As far as the sushi went it was pretty good! I felt the rice was fresh and the right amount of stickiness and the the quality of the fish was pretty good. I was not a huge fan of the Texas roll but it sure tastes like the sushi embodiment of texas. As far as sushi there is a huge variety so really its a place that’ll keep you coming back to try more.  The fried items like Takoyaki, Gyozas and Sesame balls were really tasty and came out nice warm. I really enjoyed the Takoyaki, it had a nice texture, complimented with a nice sauce and garnish. It’s definitely worth trying but it does have Octopus.  The portioning of the food is great, it’s nice to be able to try many different menu items and not feel bloated afterwards.  For the atmosphere. It is a tight space but they have make efficient use of it. The group booths are very private with high backs so it feels like a much more intimate experience. If you go alone they have bar style seating where you can sit alone in front of a ordering display. Pretty sure they are social distancing people in those seating.  I really like being able to order off the display, especially during covid times. In general I enjoy it just because I like to just be in my own thoughts or enjoying company and not being distracted throughout my meal.  Overall the food is worth trying and a welcome addition to Chinatown. Great value and fun-wide menu that gives you the opportunity to have a new and distinct meal every visit.
